Transparency.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: UPS Unveils Game-Changing UPSÂ® Global Checkout
relevantSources.summary: UPS Global Checkout uses AI to calculate correct duties and fees, providing transparency on international shipping costs and eliminating surprise charges at delivery.

relevantSources.title: How UPS Leverages AI to Level Up Logistics
relevantSources.summary: UPS leverages AI models to track packages in sorting facilities and optimize vehicle routing, providing transparency into ETAs and delivery processes.

relevantSources.title: AI In The UPS Industry: Transformative Statistics Forecast $50 Billion Savings
relevantSources.summary: UPS implements AI algorithms that improve package tracking accuracy to 99.9% and help predict delivery time windows with 98% accuracy.

relevantSources.title: UPS Cuts Email Response Time in Half with AI Automation
relevantSources.summary: UPS's Message Response Automation (MeRA) system uses large language models to automate customer email responses, reducing resolution time by 50%.

relevantSources.title: UPS Uses Artificial Intelligence For Pricing
relevantSources.summary: UPS employs AI-based pricing solutions that enhance revenue quality while maintaining transparency in their pricing transformation.

Transparency.findings: Multiple sources provide concrete examples of UPS using AI to enhance transparency in pricing, package tracking, and customer communications. These include AI-powered tools that offer upfront cost information, improve delivery time predictions, and automate customer service. The evidence demonstrates UPS's commitment to making its AI-driven operations transparent to customers and stakeholders.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: 5 Ways UPS is Using AI [Case Study][2025]
relevantSources.summary: UPS has deployed AI-driven tools to improve transparency and accountability in sustainability efforts, building trust with stakeholders through fair and unbiased reporting.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: The only relevant source for this pillar describes UPS's use of AI for transparency and stakeholder trust, with a brief mention of fairness in reporting. However, there is no detailed discussion of specific bias mitigation methods or fairness metrics. No concrete evidence of systematic bias mitigation or fairness assessments was found.

Explainability.justification: Score = 1 because 4 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: How Does AI Power UPS's Operations?
relevantSources.summary: UPS discusses how AI technologies like ORION system work to optimize delivery routes and explains the decision-making process behind route selections.

relevantSources.title: UPS paves the way for better service with faster development and artificial intelligence
relevantSources.summary: UPS explains how their Bot Framework and LUIS technology enables natural language understanding in their chatbot, making AI interactions more interpretable to users.

relevantSources.title: How UPS Uses AI to Save $200 Million a Year
relevantSources.summary: UPS describes how their ORION AI platform uses advanced algorithms and provides insight into how it analyzes data to optimize routes and reduce costs.

relevantSources.title: UPS Launches Chatbot and Accelerates Path Toward Use of Artificial Intelligence
relevantSources.summary: UPS chatbot uses natural language understanding that becomes more skilled at tasks as people interact with it, providing explanatory feedback on shipping processes.

Explainability.findings: UPS provides detailed explanations of how its AI systems, such as ORION and chatbots, operate and make decisions. Sources include technical descriptions and video transcripts that clarify the logic behind route optimization and conversational AI. These artifacts demonstrate a strong commitment to explainability and user understanding.

Human Oversight & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 3 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: UPS using AI to prevent 'porch pirates' from stealing packages
relevantSources.summary: UPS's DeliveryDefense program uses AI to analyze delivery data and generate risk assessments, with human oversight to recommend alternative delivery options.

relevantSources.title: 4 ways AI is changing how UPS delivers
relevantSources.summary: UPS's NPT system is managed by engineers who make critical decisions while collecting data to train AI models, maintaining human oversight of complex logistics operations.

relevantSources.title: UPS is using A.I. to protect your packages. How did they build it?
relevantSources.summary: UPS DeliveryDefense Address Confidence uses AI infrastructure with human accountability through data cleansing and model refinement processes.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: UPS's AI systems are overseen by human experts who review outputs and make critical decisions, especially in delivery security and logistics optimization. Artifacts describe processes for human review and accountability in AI-powered systems. This demonstrates that UPS maintains robust human oversight and accountability mechanisms for its AI deployments.

Privacy & Security.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: UPS using AI to prevent 'porch pirates' from stealing packages
relevantSources.summary: UPS utilizes DeliveryDefense to analyze delivery data and address characteristics to combat package theft, enhancing security for consumers' deliveries.

relevantSources.title: UPS is using A.I. to protect your packages. How did they build it?
relevantSources.summary: UPS DeliveryDefense Address Confidence uses BigQuery for secure data warehousing and implements fraud detection models for shipping transactions.

Privacy & Security.findings: UPS leverages AI to enhance the privacy and security of its delivery operations, including secure data warehousing and fraud detection. The sources provide concrete details on how AI is used to protect customer data and prevent package theft. This demonstrates a clear commitment to privacy and security in AI applications.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 3 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 2025 Proxy Statement - UPS Investor Relations
relevantSources.summary: UPS's proxy statement mentions AI powering Network Planning Tools, with governance oversight from the board for technology implementations.

relevantSources.title: Proxy Statement - UPS Investor Relations
relevantSources.summary: UPS's Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee oversees policy implementation and regularly reviews activities related to technology governance.

relevantSources.title: 2024 GRI - About UPS
relevantSources.summary: UPS's Audit Committee is responsible for overseeing compliance with the Code of Conduct and reviewing related transactions, ensuring accountability in all operations.

Governance & Accountability.findings: UPS's governance structure includes board-level oversight of AI and technology initiatives, with dedicated committees for policy and compliance. Annual and proxy reports detail these governance mechanisms and accountability processes. This provides strong evidence of formal governance and oversight for AI-related activities.

Public Commitments & External Audits.justification: Score = 0 because none of the researched sources address Public Commitments & External Audits in any meaningful way.
Public Commitments & External Audits.findings: No public evidence found for this pillar.

summary.overallFindings: UPS demonstrates strong responsible AI practices in transparency, explainability, human oversight, privacy, and governance, with multiple sources providing detailed operational evidence. The company is especially notable for its transparency in AI-powered logistics and customer-facing tools, as well as clear board-level oversight of technology. However, there is a lack of public evidence regarding systematic fairness and bias mitigation, and no documentation of public commitments or external audits related to AI ethics. Overall, UPS scores well but should strengthen its public-facing commitments and fairness practices to achieve top-tier responsible AI maturity.
